description.en: As most of the international law is made within, or under the auspices of international organisations, it is essential to study also the legal framework and operational mechanisms of these organisations and their contribution to the development of international law. The course provides broad overview of the law of international institutions, e.g. legal mechanisms that give the international institutions the power, international legal personality, treaty-making power, privileges and immunities, legal responsibility of the institutions etc. In addition to the theoretical overview, the decisions of international courts (ICJ, ICC, ECHR) and discussions in commissions and other international foras (ILC, ILA) are also analyzed in order to enhance practical knowledge of the subject.
description.et: Kuna suur osa rahvusvahelisest õigusest on kirjutatud rahvusvaheliste organisatsioonide poolt või nende egiidi all, on oluline tunda ka nende organisatsioonide ja institutsioonide õiguslikku raamistikku, nende pädevusi ning nende toimimist, aga ka nende panust rahvusvahelise õiguse arengusse. Kursuse käigus antakse ülevaade rahvusvaheliste institutsioonide õigusest, so nende ülesehitusest, nende õigustest ja kohustustest, nende õigusloome pädevusest, neile antud privileegidest ja immuniteetidest ning nende rahvusvahelisest vastutusest. Lisaks teoreetilisele ülevaatele analüüsitakse kursuse käigus ka rahvusvaheliste kohtute otsuseid ning asjassepuutuvate rahvusvaheliste komisjonide arutelusid ja aruandeid.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide an overview of international institutions, their powers and functioning, as well as the rules and legal acts regulating their operation and the responsibilities of international institutions. The course is aimed to broaden students' knowledge about the operation of international institutions, their treaty-making powers and processes and their contributions to the development of international law.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda ülevaade rahvusvahelisetest institutsioonidest, nende õiguslikust ja materiaalsest toimimisest, nende tegevust reguleerivatest reeglitest ja õigusaktidest ning rahvusvaheliste organisatsioonide vastutusest. Kursus arendab üliõpilase teadmisi rahvusvaheliste institutsioonide õiguslikust regulatsioonist, samuti nende panusest rahvusvahelisse õigusesse ja selle arendamisse.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has passed the course is able to:
-	Identify the central principles of the law of international institutions
-	Define the sources governing the legal personality of international organizations
learning_outcomes.et: -	Määratleb rahvusvaheliste institutsioonide õigusvõime peamisi allikaid

learning_outcomes.en: -	Describe the relationship between international organizations and their Member States
learning_outcomes.et: -	Selgitab rahvusvaheliste institutsioonide ja nende osalisriikide omavahelisi suhteid

learning_outcomes.en: -	Explain international organization's treaty making processes
-	Compare mandates of different international institutions
-	Solve hypothetical cases of legal responsibility of international institutions
learning_outcomes.et: -	Lahendab rahvusvaheliste institutsioonide õigusliku vastutusega seotud hüpoteetilisi kaasuseid

notes.et:
"As to the core idea of the examination process:
1. Exam will consist of 3 analytical questions (there will be a word limit set, to prevnt it from extrapolating into a longish opinion piece).
2. First question will address one of the fundamental aspects of the law (e.g. legal personality, inherent powers, responsibility, etc). Second question will ask for comparative approach towards a particular aspect of functioning of the organisations (e.g. immunities, legal/administrative actions, financing, etc.) Third question will be of a practical nature - you will be given a short scenario (bundle of facts) and asked to provide advice pertaining to the facts at hand. (In a nutshell, last question is a very robust simulation of a day-to-day work of a legal adviser. No real time to get your ducks in a row. Quick, short and straight to the point. You are expected to be brief and precise. It is not a place to "shine bright like a diamond". It's more of a "row, row, row, your boat" kind of a thing.)
3. As I already pointed out in the beginning on the course - this is the "big leagues". So I will compose the questions in a way that I will not really need to observe you online while you answer them (just like the classic "takeaway" exam). Point being, it's all in the argumentation and details. Descriptive generalisations will do you no good. 
As always, any suspicion of plagiarism or other mischievous deeds will lead to penalties. 
I know these are tough and demanding times, but I am sure you will do just fine. You have the materials. Refresh you memory and stay healthy.
More details coming soon!
Aleksandr Popov"

independent_work.et:
*	Independent work with study materials
*	Writing a research paper
In the research paper, the student analyses one legal problem in connection with the international institutions. The list of relevant problems/research questions will be provided by the teacher in charge in the beginning of the course. The selected problem should be registered via e-mail no later than on the day of last lecture. The teacher may ask the student to choose another problem if too many students have already chosen the same question. The paper should be submitted electronically as a Word-file no later than on .... via the e-mail address provided by the teacher in charge. For every started overdue day, the result will be decreased by four points, but papers which are late more than four days are not accepted and the student may not take the exam. 
The paper must include title page, table of content, main body and list of used materials. For references, use footnotes. The length of main text (starting from the introduction and ending with the conclusion, excluding footnotes) should be 1500-2500 words. Shorter papers are not accepted or the result is lowered by the discretion of the teacher.
Independent identification of clear issues and legal problems is very important. Also, the use of different sources and supportive materials. All used sources must be referred to. In case of internet sources, the full address is necessary, not only the main domain (e.g. www.un.org). A paper based on copy-paste method leads to negative results for both the paper and the exam. Plagiarism is not tolerated at the University of Tartu.

The research paper must be submitted to the e-mail: sass.popov.1984@gmail.com no later than October 30th at 1700.

grade_preconditions.et:
*	Participation in all seminars.
If a student did not participate in a seminar, he/she must submit, within a week, a one-page solution to a case solved in the particular seminar. Each late submission of a summary decreases the final points by three points.
*	Timely submission and positive evaluation of a research paper.

*	Written exam with three questions (60 points):
definition (10 points)
theoretical concept (20 points)
hypothetical case (30 points)
*	Research paper (40 points)

grade_evaluation.et:
Criteria
*	Consistency, completeness and correctness of the answers to theoretical questions
*	Creativeness and consistency of the solutions to hypothetical cases 
*	Depth of the analysis of problems and applicable norms and principles
*	Association of theory with state and court practice
*	Structure, grammar and formatting
Grades
A	Answers to theoretical questions are remarkable; the examination of hypothetical cases is full, logical and creative; the analysis of legal problems is detailed and innovative; all relevant norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice are thoughtful and creative; the form is excellent; overall, the text is a remarkable achievement [91-100 points]
B	Answers to theoretical questions are very good with insignificant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is purposeful and creative; the analysis of legal problems is very good with insignificant deficiencies; necessary norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice support the conclusions; the form is very good; overall, the treatment of the subject is logical and smooth [81-90 points]
C	Answers to theoretical questions are good, but there are mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases addresses correctly the central issues; the analysis of legal problems is good with some deficiencies concerning specific issues; key norms and principles have been used; the form is good; overall, the coverage of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses from the point of view of the whole [71-80 points]
D	Answers to theoretical questions are fair, but there are several mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is satisfactory, but focuses only on the central aspects; the analysis of legal problems is satisfactory with deficiencies is most aspects; only basic norms and principles have been used; the form is fair; overall, the treatment of the subject is plausible.
